brief_summary.textblock:
This study will be a quality improvement project to review the effectiveness and barriers to
      effectiveness of a new clinical program in the emergency room to provide substance use
      screening followed by brief motivational interviewing and referral to treatment for patients
      who meet criteria for problem substance use. This study will consist of a chart review of
      the results of the screens performed by substance use counselors and correlating them to
      institutional variables such as wait time in the emergency room and length of stay as well
      as to patient variables obtained by chart review such as medical diagnosis and
      sociodemographic variables.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment With Substance Use Disorders in the Emergency Room Setting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 19 and older Presentation to UAB Emergency Department

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Younger than 19 Prisoners

intervention.intervention_name: Motivational interviewing and referral to treatment

clinical_study.official_title: Brief Intervention and Referral to Treatment With Substance Use Disorders in the Emergency Room Setting (Screening and Brief Treatment for Substance Use Disorders in the Emergency Room Department)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Screening
